block.p: Marisa Guillen Farina, a daughter of Carmen and Antonio Farina of Brooklyn, is to be married today to Anthony Paul Bertoldo, a son of Lillian and Patrick Bertoldo of Colts Neck, N.J. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, is to officiate at TriBeCa Rooftop in Manhattan.

Ms. Farina, 28, is keeping her name. She is the marketing director in Manhattan for Time Out New York magazine. She graduated from Connecticut College. Her mother is the principal of Public School 6 on the Upper East Side. Her father retired as the comptroller of the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center in Manhattan.

Ms. Farina, 28, is keeping her name. She is the marketing director in Manhattan for Time Out New York magazine. She graduated from Connecticut College. Her mother is the principal of Public School 6 on the Upper East Side. Her father retired as the comptroller of the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center in Manhattan.

Mr. Bertoldo, 27, graduated from Boston College and received an M.B.A. from Duke University. Next month he is to become a trader at Credit Suisse First Boston in Manhattan. His mother is a registered nurse. His father is an executive vice president for sales at Unimac Graphics, a printing business in Carlstadt, N.J.
